sentence.text: It irritates me that I ca n't think of enough rare foods I have n't had and have wanted to have .
Sometimes he irritates me so much that I could scream at him .
The slower pace bored and irritated them so much that they longed to go back and their parents were almost glad to see them off .
In pre-war days this fleet continued to irritate the Japanese who considered it a threat .
Sometimes er it irritates me when they come .

It irritated her to think that she had n't been doing anything reckless like running to catch a bus ; but she had a private theory that an old person did n't break a hip because she fell , but fell because her hip snapped , after gradual erosion .
At theological college , near Oxford , the docility of most of the wives of other students irritated Anna .
Nan showed no pleasure at the compliment -- in fact Emily seemed to think it irritated her .
The mistake irritated him .
From an early age , Sara had sensed that she irritated him , by her presence , by the fact that she was there to remind him of his wife 's earlier marriage .
His amiability irritated Meredith ; it made him spiteful .
She renounced the role of tragic widow with an austerity that irritated her would-be saviours .
Some horses also like to tease us , to irritate us with trivial annoyances -- and especially in front of an audience .
When Roland arrived in Lincoln he was already irritated by having to take the train .
He was irritated by my disbelief and pointed forcefully in the same direction as before , shouting , ` Reggane ! "
She never asked if she could help in the kitchen since she knew Alice would be irritated by an offer which she knew to be impractical and insincere .
Blanche 's eyes widened slightly , as though she had been irritated by the reply .
To be irritated by criticism is to acknowledge it was deserved .
If you are late you may irritate the interviewer or lose your appointment altogether .
But over the years , his sales techniques have irritated as much as they have impressed , and he has been periodically banned from Celtic Park , Tynecastle and Fir Park .
